body.p:
Hopkinsville Ky.
March 22nd 1861
Hon B Magoffin
Dr Sir,

A Pettion of the citizens of our town in behalf of a free man of color by the name of Georg Long, ^will be forwarded you by this mail^ I have been requested by the former owners of Georg to tell you what I think of the case,

1st I have known the Boy for 15 years & with probably one exception he is the best behaved boy I have ever Known, 2nd The prosecution I am satisfied is a metitious one, I heard the trial (but was not his Counsel,) I am satisfied that the witness said more than he Should have said, The Verdict is a hard one, & in my opinion should you feel Justified in granting the relief praid in the petition, it will meet the wishes of our entire community, with the single exception
of the witness alluded to whom in my opinion is not, nor never has, been half so good a Citizen as Georg, (the petitioner), It is not often that we find a good free negrow & I think where we have one we should treat them him with humanity & give him full Justice I am truly sorry to hear of your misfortune in getting burnt & hope before this you are convalesent,

Truly your frd
S, M, Bernard
